bibl.title: Pollutant Lead Reveals the Pre-Hellenistic Occupation and Ancient Growth of Alexandria, Egypt.
bibl.note: New geochemical data from Alexandria's ancient bay sediments evidence thriving pre-Hellenistic settlements in Alexandria. During the Greek and Roman periods, the lead pollution is the largest encountered in ancient city sediments, and twice as high as in contemporary industrialized estuaries.
bibl.seg: Véron Alain, Jean-Philippe Goiran, Christophe Morhange, Nick Marriner and Jean-Yves Empereur, Pollutant Lead Reveals the Pre-Hellenistic Occupation and Ancient Growth of Alexandria, Egypt.
Geophysical Research Letters 33 (2006) 4 pp., 2 figg., 1 tabl. [Accessible en ligne, en téléchargement gratuit: < http://www.archeorient.mom.fr/FICHES/pdf/Lead%20Alexandria%202006.pdf >.]

New geochemical data from Alexandria's ancient bay sediments evidence thriving pre-Hellenistic settlements in Alexandria. During the Greek and Roman periods, the lead pollution is the largest encountered in ancient city sediments, and twice as high as in contemporary industrialized estuaries.
